tagDescription: Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana, New Orleans: Resumption of specie payment by the bank. Also letter of 16 August 1842 relative to bonds of the State of Louisiana.
Thomas Baring to Baring Bros. & Co. Comments on various topics - Calcutta news - American securities - &c.
Jacob Little & Co. Mr. J.S. Armstrong of the Commercial Bank of Cincinnati will appear as witness in fraud case against Clinton.
R.D. Shepherd: Union Bank Bonds.
R.D. Shepherd to T.W. Ward: Sale of Canal Street Stores.
James Murray, Supt. of Machinery, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad, to Louis McLean - Re affairs of the Company.
Louis McLane to T.W. Ward - Maryland affairs.
Alfred Kelley: Marketing of Ohio State stocks.
Wm. Ropes: Left Russia and embarks for New York. Sugar trade.
Jas. Freshfield Jr. to T. Baring. Respecting Illinois Canal Debt.
Horace William, Treasurer, Boston and Worcester Railroad: Order for rails.
John H. Hicks: Favourable reference to Wm. Mure.
Chas. Oakley to John Wright, London - On Illinois affairs - reference to trade with Canada.
John Howard Payne, United States Consul, Tunis, To Joshua Bates - re payment of his consular salary through the House of Baring.

Joshua Bates, New York to Baring Bros.& Co. Affairs of Chesapeake & Ohio Railroad - Cotton crop- Oelrich & Lurman - State Stocks - Proceedings of Congress - Canada Bonds and Lord Sydenham. N.B. For O.& L. see also 30 July,1841.
Ward to Messrs. Grant & Stone, Philadelphia: Advises on business deals.

Copy of 4th Section of "An Act to increase the Revenue of the State of Louisiana"-Also copy of "An Act explanatory of the 924th Article of the code of Practice for the administration of the succession of strangers dying possessed of property within the State of Louisiana and for other purposes".
J.W. Perkins: Cancelled the authority to Sam Jaudon to dispose of a portion of the Ohio 7% Loan.
Balance Sheet of Baring Bros. & Co's Ledger.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward: Passage of Coupon Bill pushed up stocks.
J.B. Varnum: Inquiry about Power of Attorney to collect legacy.
Benjamin Story, President, Bank of Louisiana: Investment of funds in the Louisiana Bonds.
Arch Gracie: Sales of cotton reached 20,000 bales.
John P. Ingle: Purchase of State Bonds by Oelrichs & Lurman.
H. Lavergne, President Consolidated Association to Baring Bros. & Co. Re condition of distress, commercial and financial, in New Orleans. Affairs of the Consolidated Association Bank.
Van Wart Son & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. In relation to the purity of the Mexican copper coin supposed to have been made in Birmingham.
T. Turner, Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co., to T.W. Ward: Relative to State Bonds.
A. Dassier: Business matters.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton crop of inferior quality.
Wotherspoon & Co.: Flour, cotton and ashes market.
Stetson & Avery: Advance on consignment of cotton.
Judge John C. Spencer, Comptroller of the State of New York to J. Bates - Re placing 5% Stock on the domestic market - not connected with the three million loan spoken of previously.
F.Fastenrath: Relative to Mr. Whiteside, The Fund Commissioner for Illinois.

Richard Willing to Baring Bros. & Co. Notifies them that Bench Warrants have been issued against Nicholas Biddle, Joseph Copperthwait, Samuel Jaudon, Thomas Dunlap, Alex Lardner and several Directors of the Pennsylvania Bank, for fraud committed in 1836 - 1841.
Settlement made by the Gas Bank of her debt due the old United States Bank and held by the Morrisons of London.
Fred. Frey, Cashier of the Union Bank of Louisiana, New Orleans, to Baring Bros. & Co. Transmitting Resolutions adopted by the Board of Directors with regard to Bond-holders and Debtors.
Thomas Turner to Baring Bros. & Co. In regard to a sale of the State Bonds of Maryland in their hands belonging to the Company - very detailed.
Jos. Saul (Cashier United States Branch Bank, New Orleans in 1804) to Baring Bros. & Co. His opinion on the affairs of the Union Bank of Louisiana.
Maryland - An Act to sell the State's interest in the Internal Improvement Companies and to pay the debts of the State.
John Brough, State Auditor: Regrets the depressed state of Ohio stocks.
George Peabody: Remittances to meet the Maryland dividends.
Louis McLane: Sale of part of Public Works under the authority of the Legislature of Pennsylvania.
Statement of the Affairs of the Consolidated Association - Enclosed in 3 September 1842.
Chas. Stetson to J. Bates - Giving information relating to New Orleans Banks and their standing - also particulars re Debt of the City of New Orleans.
Jacob Little: Relating to G.F. Webb.
J.A. Stevens, Bank of Commerce, New York: Shipment of specie.
Statement of the Affairs of the Consolidated Association. Enclosed in 3 September, 1842.
J.W.Zacharie & Co.: Theodore Zacharie will remit for the purpose of investment in Louisiana Bonds.
Louis McLane: One fifth of receipts from passengers on the Washington road to go to the school fund.
Josiah Quincy Jr., Treasurer Western Railroad Co. to J. Bates re affairs of Western Railroad.
J. Bates to H. Mildmay - The new administration - proposed National Bank - Bank of Commerce - Railroads &c - State Securities - Oelrich & Lurman &c.
New Orleans - Movement of the Banks.
J.J. Atkinson to T.W. Ward: Provision by the Legislature for payment of interest on public debt.
Henry VanWart: Fraud in connection with J. Little & Co.
Benjamin Story: Shipment of specie from Mexico. Bank of Louisiana will not pay the bonds falling due.
C. Bolton, Fox & Livingston: Asks not to buy the Florida bonds.
Jno. A. Stevens to J. Bates - Detailed information re Ohio Stocks.
Robert Jones: Relating to the affairs of John Bowen & Co.
General statement of the Union Bank of Louisiana.
Nathan Hale to T.W. Ward - Re statement of the prospects of the Western Railroad, which he promises to send later.
Jacob Little & Co.: Relative to forgeries perpetrated on the firm.
Jacob Little & Co.: Warns of $ fraudulent United States Treasury Notes. Encloses list with serial numbers of these.
Grant & Stone to Baring Bros. & co. Re closing of Girard Bank.

Thomas Turner, Clerk, Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co., to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing letter from Col. James M. Coale, newly elected President of the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co. containing a statement of the affairs of the Canal.
Baltimore Bank Statements - condensed view of the condition of the Banks of the City of Baltimore.
Rail Road Return: Data pertaining to various railroads.
Jas. Freshfield, Jr.: Payment on the Illinois Canal Bonds contingent on the Governor.
Josiah Quincy, Jr.: Disposal of $700,000 of Massachusetts Stirling Bonds.
Benjamin H. Latrobe and James Murray (Baltimore & Ohio Railroad) to Louis McLane, President - Comparative Statement of working Railroads.
Josiah Quincy, Jr.: Remittance to cover interest on the Massachusetts stock.
Grant & Stone: Request for agency for Lloyds.
Benjamin Story, President, Bank of Louisiana: Request to purchase bonds of the State of Louisiana.
J.J. Achinson, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Balance sheet.
Alfred Kelley: Payment of interest on Ohio State stocks; prospects of abundant wheat crop.
Sam Sanford: Requests loan of £20,000 pounds on mortgage.
Duff Green to J. Bates: Maryland Bonds.

Jno. A. Parker to Baring Bros. & Co. Outline of the Plan for the establishment in the City of London of an Agency to be named the "United States Agency for Public Stocks". Enclosing copies of letters to Charles Stokes and Henry Chapman.
Arch. Gracie: Price of cotton rising.
W. Delano, Jr.: Ship Akbar damaged on voyage from China.
Nathan Hale: Reports on the affairs of the Western Railroad Co.
Amount of Stocks owned by the State of Pennsylvania which paid dividends in 1841.
Grant & Stone: Funded debt of Pennsylvania; reports abundant crops. Encloses memo on the Philadelphia, Wilmington & Baltimore Railroad Co.
List of banks in New Orleans: Amount of money in circulation.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton trade.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton market.
R.B. Forbes: Business connection with Rathbone Brothers & Co., Liverpool.
Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana: Proposes postponement of payment of interest on bonds. Also letter of 4 March 1843.
J. Loyd: Stock account.
Unsigned Memo for Baring Bros. & Co. on the subject of the delinquent States.
Josiah Quincy, Jr.: Remits $130,000 from the Western Railroad Co.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward: Press copy relating to the payment on State Bonds.
Josiah Quincy: Railroad almost completed. Expects monopoly on freight between New England, Canada and the Western States.
F. Fastenrath: Illinois Fund Commissioners to proceed to London to make financial arrangements.
E.W. Hubbard and John Brough, Ohio Loan Comrs. to Baring Bros. & Co. Re financial affairs of Ohio.
Louis McLane to J. Bates: Cautioning him against an application which may be made to him in regard to State Bonds - Fuller details promised.
Josiah Quincy, Jr. Treasurer W. Railroad Co. to J. Bates. Informs them that the Road between Boston & Albany will be opened at once for freight and passengers.
State of Maryland - Active Debt of the State.
Great Western Steamship office: Passage aboard the ship.
Robert Gilmore to J. Bates - Complimentary reference to Lord Ashburton and his Mission - Comments on State Debts.
Arch. Gracie: Expects small cotton crop because of heavy rains.
G. Stone: Transactions in American stocks unsatisfactory.
J.A. Parker: Advances theory on payment of public debts in America.
Thos. Turner, Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co. to T.W. Ward: Company would not sell bonds at the price proposed by Barings.
Joshua Bates: Sam G. Ward established commission business in Boston.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton trade.
Richard Willing to Baring Bros. & Co. On the subject of the State Improvements of Pennsylvania.
W.G. Ewing to Joshua Bates. Concerning trade in furs.
T.W. Ward to J.H. Latrobe: Statement of expenses incurred in the matter of lost bonds.
Wm. Sturgis, Jr.: Arrangement on outstanding liabilities.
T.W. Ward to The President, Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co.: Reimbursement for 133,000 pounds of Maryland Bonds.
Josiah Quincy, Jr.: Another 20% assessment on the stock of the Western Railroad.
Arch. Gracie: Purchases of cotton.
Geo. Bacon to Baring Bros. & Co. Mines of the United States, copper, coal, lead &c.
George McIntosh: Son to ply a vessel to Canton.
T.W. Ward to R.D. Shepherd, New Orleans: Refers to the affairs of Messrs. Stetson & Avery.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward: State debt and ways of settling it.
Wm. H. Robertson: Failure of S.F.S. Wilder; cotton, tobacco and wheat markets. Encloses circular of 1 July 1842 advising of change of address.
Jno. A. Parker to J. Bates. Proposing a plan for settling the State Debts. Encloses letter of 30 January 1843 from Jacob Little & Co.
J.H. B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward: Price of State Stocks.
Joshua Bates to Baring Bros. & Co. Comments on the proceedings of Congress - American State Debts &c. Progress of New England - Bank of United States &c.
R.D. Shepherd to T.W. Ward - concerning Banking Laws passed in New Orleans.
Wm. Mure to J. Bates re employing him as the agent of their House in New Orleans.
Sam Allinson to J. Bates - re sale of Public Works of Pennsylvania. Re formation of Company to conduct these works at the head of which is J. Hare Powell.
Wm. Sturgis: Asks to be released from indebtedness. Encloses letter of 19 May 1843.
Joshua Bates: Goes to Washington; opines on security of various state stocks, political and business matters.
Wm. B. Reed to T.W. Ward - Comprehensive account of Pennsylvania affairs.
T.W. Ward to R.D. Shepherd - Re resumption of Specie payments. Press Copy.
John H.B. Latrobe to Baring Bros.& Co. Concerning Maryland finances.
Wm. Gibbs McNeill, President Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Re postponing of their contemplated sale until action of Legislature is known.
J. Bates to T. Baring - Ohio Commissioners' wants - The Cotton crop & c.

George Stone to Baring Bros. & Co. Asking a letter of introduction to their correspondents, Messrs. Barlow & Co. of Saint John, New Brunswick, as he is to make an enquiry there of a very confidential nature.
J.M. Forbes: Law suit of Russell & Co. vs. Nat. Goddard.
D. Crommelin & Sons: Gloomy forecast relative to State debts and American credit in general.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton market.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton crop.
P.C. Grattan: Refers to proceedings against him.
H. Lavergne, Cons. Planters of Louisiana: Describes some results of the business depression. States that Cons. Planters of Louisiana will not pay their bonds due in June 1843.
Louis McLane to Joshua Bates. Enters fully into details of the attitude of the State Legislature towards repudiation- The Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co. Affairs.
Extracts of letters re Cotton crop from Lanfear, Hicks, Gwathney.
N.H. Swayne and Alfred Kelley, Commissioners Ohio Canal Fund, to Baring Bros. & Co. Statement of Ohio Stocks.
Amedee A. Baudouin to Baring Bros. & Co. Submits a proposition re financial affairs of New Orleans.
D. Crommelin & Sons: Payment of interest on Maryland 3% bonds.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward: Press copy relating to financial affairs.
Arch. Gracie to T.W. Ward: Money market; cotton trade.
Josiah Quincy, Jr.: Interest on Massachusetts stock.
Ward & Simmons to T.W.Ward: Decline in rates of exchange; cotton, sugar, tobacco and coffee markets.
Newspaper Extract: Re Incorporation of the Delaware Canal Co.
Arch. Gracie: Concerning city property. Enclosed newspaper extract with Report of the Finance Committee.
T.W. Ward to R.D. Shepherd, New Orleans: more on the affairs of Messrs. Stetson & Avery.
Fred. Frey, Cashier Union Bank of Louisiana to Baring Bros. & Co. On the affairs of the Bank.
Copy of contract between the Commissioner of the Ohio Canal Fund and Baring Brothers & Co. for the purchase of Ohio 6% stock.
Josiah Quincy, Treasurer Western Railroad Co. to Joshua Bates - Re the Directors laying an additional assessment of 20 per cent on the whole amount of the Stock.
Folch y Juan: Sketch of a speculation in the island of Cuba for the approval of Baring Bros. & Co.
John A. Parker to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing pamphlet containing copies of letters addressed by him to the President of the United States on the subject of the State Debts.
Henry Van Wart: Information on people involved in swindle against Messrs. Jacob Little & Co.
C.A. Davis to J. Bates - enclosing an address to Congress re a Hill to enable the Treasury to borrow money at home from the monied institutions of our own people & c.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton market.
Alfred Kelley, Commissioner of the Ohio Canal Fund, New York: Regulation for authenticating stock certificates.
Denison & Co.: Dividend on $800,000 worth of State of Mississippi bonds.
C. Bolton, Fox & Livingston: Order to buy $25,000 of Florida bonds.
H. Lavergne: Recommends Amedee A. Baudouin
J.W. Perkins: Mr. S. Jaudon to negotiate a portion of the Ohio 7% State Loan.
T. Baring: Purchase of American securities; news from Asia; Indigo and cotton market.
S.S. Gair to C.B. Young: Depth of water at the mouth of the Mississippi.
A. Dassiel: Financial matters.
Arch. Gracie: Reduced prices for cotton.
A. Miltenberger (A. Ledoux & Co.); Recommends Amedee A. Baudouin.
J.I. Eschalas to J. Bates - comments on public affairs in United States - Refers to effect of Lord Ashburton's arrival on public feeling - Offers himself for the next vacancy in the House.
Arch. Gracie: Shipments of specie to New Orleans; cotton market.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton market; Presidential veto of the Bank Bill.
Grant & Stone: Meeting of bankers; closing of Girard Bank.

John Forrest (Illinois) to Baring Bros. & Co. Refers to newspaper account of a Land Company to be Established in London, for the purpose of encouraging emigration to Illinois, Michigan and Iowa - Then follow details of his own plan for Emigration to Illinois.
Grant & Stone: Closing of Girard Bank.
George Mackubin, Treasurer Western Shore, Maryland, to Baring Bros. & Co. Maryland financial condition.
Amedee A.Baudouin: Cotton, tobacco, flour, wheat, lard and lead; rate of exchange.
Correspondence re Shipment of Iron for the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad. Enclosed in 25 April 1842.
List of firms with outstanding credits.
Enoch Train: Finds impossible to remit balance because of heavy losses.
George Stone, Junior: Letter of introduction for Mr. Cunard.
Josiah Quincy, Jr.: Will dispose of the whole issue of the Massachusetts 5% bonds.
Robert Gilmor: Encloses letter from George MacKubin, Western Shore Treasury, Annapolis, of 10 June 1842 with financial statement.
Wm. Appleton to J. Bates - State Debts - Lack of confidence in American Stocks - The Bank of Commerce.
John G. Moses: Arrival of the ship Nestor.
J. Knight to Louis McLane, President, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Statement of income which the railroad expects to yield.

Joshua Bates, Baltimore, to H. Mildmay - American stocks - good, doubtful and the awfully bad being Bank United States American Trust Co., N. American Trust & Banking Co. & Morris Canal & Banking Co. - Maryland affairs.
Chas. Stetson: Cotton market; order for flour.
A. Gracie to J. Bates - Alabama Finances.
Wm. Appleton: Relative to the Massachusetts bonds.

George Mackubin, Treasurer Western Shore, Maryland, to T.W. Ward. Concerning the reimbursement to the Messrs. Baring for their advance for the State in payment of the interest due in London 1 January 1842. Press Copy.
R.D. Shepherd to T.W. Ward: Description of the plantation offered by Stetson & Avery in settlement of their debt.
J.A. Stevens, Bank of Commerce: Relating to loans. Enclosed letter from Jas. Gilmore, State Treasurer of Pennsylvania of 30 November 1841.
Grant & Stone: Current prices of commodities; new tariff, money matters. Expectation of a huge grain crop.
Jacob Barker to T.W. Ward - Concerning New Orleans Banks.
Arch. Gracie: City finances; cotton.
Jno. A. Stevens, Jas. D. Ogden and Henry Brevoort, Com. Merchants' Exchange Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Present state and prospects of the Merchants' Exchange Co., New York. List of Trustees enclosed.
Leland Brothers & Co.: Cotton market.
Jacob Little & Co.: Arrest of one of the forgers.
Alfred Kelley: Return of the Ohio 6% stock because no agreement reached.
Amedee A.Baudouin: Cotton market; rate of Exchange on bills.
Richard Willing to Baring Bros. & Co. Announces the arrival of Lord Ashburton at Annapolis.
Grant & Stone: Confusion as to tariff; no provision for payment of interest on Pennsylvania loan. The Boundary Question.
Arch. Gracie to J. Bates - Alabama finances. Encloses newspaper extracts of same date.
Arch. Gracie: Encloses Report of the Legislature of Alabama respecting the State Bank.
Grant & Stone to Baring Bros. & Co. Annexes a general Price Current with comments. Attitude of Maine & of Massachusetts towards the Boundary Dispute.
Jacob Little & Co.: Oliver M. Lowndes to their interests in the fraud case.
Jacob Little & Co. Order to buy stock of Planters Bank of Tennessee. Also list of London shareholder of said bank.
Josiah Quincy, Jr.: Sale of Massachusetts stock. Railroad finished and in operation.
Isaac Coe, Fund Comr., Indiana: Also Indiana Bonds, 1 July, 1838- Indiana Finances.
Geo. Peabody: Refers to misunderstanding between the Barings and the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co.
R.D. Shepherd: Louisiana Bond endorsed by the Union Bank.
Joshua Bates to H. Mildmay - The Cotton crop - The McLeod affair.
Extracts of letters from William Mure of 7 January 1842, A. Gracie of 7 January 1842 and Stetson & Avery of 12 January 1842.
Newspaper Extract: Relating to incorporation of the Pennsylvania Canal & Railroad Co.
Thomas Turner, Clerk, Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Transmitting correspondence on affairs of Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co.
John A. Stevens to J. Bates - Political changes - Webster still in the Cabinet - The McLeod affair - The Bank of Commerce &c.
Arch. Gracie: State bonds to capitalize the State Bank.
Wm. Appleton: Specie payment; import and export of specie.
J.H. Hicks: Business proposal of Mr. Guillemin of S. Mariatequi & Co., Havana.
John S. Gittings, Commissioner of Loans, Difficulties in raising money for interest on Maryland loans.
Grant & Stone to Baring Bros. & Co. Special payments have been resumed by most of the Philadelphia Banks and comments on consequences.
Unsigned Memo re mode of collection of the proposed Income Tax upon the Foreign Funds &c.
Arch. Gracie: Transactions in cotton.
Joshua Bates to M.C. Spragg, Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co.: No Further drafts against the bonds.
Joshua Bates (New York) to Baring Bros. & Co. Refers to interview with Webster - The McLeod affair - The Boundary question - F.C. Gray's Mission to London.
Josiah Quincy, Jr.: Stock market; difficulty in disposing of stocks.
D.L. Pickman to T.W. Ward: Would like to know the meaning of report.
E. Riggs, New York to Geo. Peabody, London: Highlights of his trip through the Western States, their economy. Prognostication for the future.
R.D. Shepherd: Payment on bonds; Interests of bondholders. Also letter of 20 July 1843.
Joshua Bates to H. Mildmay - Plan for putting things right in the United States in regard to currency and credit.
Snydam, Sage & Co.: Complaint of low prices which were paid for furs.
De Coninck, Spalding & Co. Havana to Matthias Purton re settlement of the estate of Geo. Knight & Co.
J.A. Stevens to T.W. Ward: Relative to the Ohio stocks.
Alfred Kelley to J.Bates - Comments on Pennsylvania financial affairs. Detailed account of Ohio's financial Status.
Olaf Wyk: American duty on rails may impede imports.
Arch. Gracie: Rains injured cotton crops.
T.S. Metcalf to T.W. Ward: Sale of sterling sovereigns.
Peschier & Forstall: Press copy relating to the securities market.
J.W. Zacharie & Co.: Expenses in connection with repairs on the ship Elizabeth.
Geo. Peabody to Baring Bros. & Co. Affairs of the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co.
Probable number of members for each State provided ratio of representation be 1 for every 60000 inhabitants.
Geo. Mackubin, Western Shore Treasury: Reports receipts of State Taxes.
R.D. Shepherd: The Legislature is considering a Liquidating bill.
Louis McLane to J. Bates. Detailed statement of the financial affairs of Ohio.
John S. Gittings, Commissioner of Loans, Maryland to Baring Bros. & Co. Re failure to remit balance of exchange necessary to meet the interest due at their Banking House on 1st January.
R.D. Shepherd to T.W. Ward: Encloses letter from Stetson & Avery about consignments of coffee of 9 June 1842.
Arch. Gracie: Rates of exchange on bills; demand for cotton.
J.L. Landon: Introduction for Amedee A. Baudouin.
John A. Stevens, President Bank of Commerce, N.Y. to Baring Bros. & Co. Instructions re certificates of the late United States Loan being forwarded to them.
Wm. Wholey: Memo and circular relating to the tobacco trade; stemmed tobacco.
C. Adams, Jr. to Baring Bros. & Co. Re affairs of Union Bank of Louisiana.
An unsigned Memo, on Indiana financial affairs - comments on a plan concocting in England for concentrating action to be directed against defaulting States.
Arch. Gracie: Copy of letter advising to sell cotton. Cotton market.
F.B. Welles: Mortgage on the estate of Geo.Knight in Cuba. Offers his services to manage the business.
J. Bates to Baring Bros. & Co. State Debts - Temperance - Reference to Upper Canada and "Pow" (Lord Sydenham).
Hon. Louis McLane, President Baltimore & Ohio Railroad, to Baring Bros. & Co. Forwarding copies of correspondence with T.W. Ward relative to the Bill of Lading and shipment of Iron per Virginia.
Comparative Statement of the Liquidation of the Consolidated Association of New Orleans.
N.A. Swayne, Alfred Kelley, P. Swan, Commissioners of the Ohio Canal Fund, Columbus: Order sale of $150,000 of Ohio 6% Stock.
W.G. Ewing: Consignment of furs and pets, to be sold by C.M. Lampson.
Arch. Gracie: Expects poor cotton crop.
Arch. Gracie: Purchases of cotton.
Circular letter signed Baring Bros. & Co. Re affairs of the Consolidated Association of Planters of Louisiana - Recapitulation of its Assets and Liabilities on 21 April 1843.
J. Bates to Baring Bros. & Co. Mr. Clay's Bank Plan - American securities &c.
W. Delano, Jr.: Shipment of goods to China.
Joshua Bates: Interview with Judge J.C. Spencer relating to 5% New York State stock.
Louis McLane: Regrets that J. Bates cannot visit him.
H. Gally, President of Board of Managers for the liquidation of Consolidated Association, to Baring Bros. & Co. On the affairs of the Institution.
T.W. Ward to R.D. Shepherd: Concerning Messrs. Stetson & Avery and shipment of cotton.
Memo re the mortgage of the Philadelphia, Wilmington & Baltimore property to Trustees - Sgd/ M. Brooke Buckley - Enclosed in 14 July, 1842.
Unsigned extract of letter from Baltimore: Maryland will remit amount due to Barings.
Robert Gilmor: Finances of the State of Maryland; obligations to foreign holders of debentures.
John H. Hicks: Business relation with the firm of L. Mariatequi & Co., Havana.
Unsigned (Maitland and Co.) report relating to the Act authorizing the city to issue debentures, providing for a Sinking Fund and a pledge of specific taxes.
Leland Brothers & Co.: Commissions on freights; prices of cotton; rates of advance. Cotton market.
Alfred Kelley to Baring Bros. & Co. Re financial condition of Ohio.
